intro: Adenandra odoratissima subsp. tenuis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf adenandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in shrubland and coastal forests, where it thrives in full sun. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrower leaves compared to other subspecies of Adenandra odoratissima.
